fields_of_interest: Trade, International co-operation and development, Environment, Maritime affairs and fisheries
eu_initiatives: EU Fisheries and marine policies, in particular Common Fisheries Policy, and Nature/Environmental legislation in the marine environment
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Expert Group for Markets and Trade in Fishery and Aquaculture Products#E02797#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2797#Member#C#Marine knowledge expert group#E03457#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3457#Member#C#Commission Expert Group on Strategic Coordination for the Marine Strategy Framework Directive #E02550#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2550#Observer#C#Working group on Good environmental Status (WG GES)#Working group Programme of Measures, Economic and Social Assessment (WG POMESA)#Working group on Data Information and Knowledge Exchange (WG DIKE)#Structured Dialogue with European Structural and Investment Funds' partners group of experts#E03226#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3226#Member#C
membership:
Oceana in Europe (Spain; Belgium; Denmark) are part of the Oceana  international network having several Offices around the world as follows:  
North America: Washington, DC; Juneau, AK; Los Angeles, CA; Toronto, Canada 
South America: Santiago, Chile; Lima, Peru; Belize city, Belize; Brazilia, Brazil 
Asia: Manila, The Philippines
goals__remit: Oceana, founded in 2001, is the largest international organization focused on ocean conservation. Oceana campaigns to protect and restore the world’s oceans. Our teams of marine scientists, economists, lawyers and advocates win specific and concrete policy changes to reduce pollution and to prevent the irreversible collapse of fish populations, marine mammals and other sea life. Global in scope and dedicated to conservation, Oceana has campaigners based in North America (Washington, DC; Juneau, AK), Europe (Madrid, Spain; Copenhagen, Denmark; Brussels, Belgium), Central America (Mexico, Belize), South America (Brazilia, Brasil and Santiago, Chile) and Asia (Phillipines).
